'''''Poems and Songs of Middle Earth''''' is a collection of verses from ''[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]'' read by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], together with [[Donald Swann]]'s (piano) and [[William Elvin]]'s (song) performance of ''[[The Road Goes Ever On (book)|The Road Goes Ever On]]'', issued by [[Wikipedia:Caedmon Audio|Caedmon Records]] on a [[Wikipedia:Gramophone record|gramophone record]] in [[1967]]. Tolkien recorded the verses on [[15 June]] [[1967]].<ref name=CG>{{CG|RG}}, p. 823</ref> 

The front of the album cover features an illustration by [[Pauline Baynes]], an artist Tolkien appreciated and frequently used.<ref>{{L|235}}</ref>  On the back [[W.H. Auden]] contributed with an introduction to Tolkien.

==Contents==

*Side One: J.R.R. Tolkien reads from The Adventures of Tom Bombadil
**The Adventures of Tom Bombadil
**The Mewlips
**The Hoard
**Perry-The-Winkle
**The Man in the Moon Came Down Too Soon
**The Sea-Bell

*Side Two
**A Elbereth Gilthoniel (read in Elvish)
**The Road Goes Ever On
***The Road Goes Ever On
***Upon the Hearth the Fire is Red
***In the Willow-Meads of Tasarinan
***In Western Lands
***Namárië
***I Sit Beside the Fire
***Errantry
